The bladder is an organ.\nExplain what t.answer: An organ is a group of different tissues that work together to perform a certain function.

What is a catalyst? (2).answer: A catalyst is a substance which INCREASES the rate of a reaction without being CHANGED or ALTERED.

Why do enzymes have an\noptimum pH value.answer: If the pH value is too high or too low, it can interfere with the bonds holding the enzyme together. This changes the shape of the active site and denatures the enzyme.
